entry.title: Is DRC worth to learn
entry.content:
Hello all,

I am investigating about DRC. I am working in Netherlands and i dont know if the companies already started to use DRC. Is it commonly used? Is it worth investing time? If yes where i can start to learn? 

Thanks in advance,

Merve

entry.title: How to pull last 14 digits of IBAN number to the Account ID tag in DME
entry.content:
Hello experts...

Need to pull the last 14 digits of the IBAN to the account Id tag in DME.

Eg:

IBAN: DK7920004374752125

ID: 20004374752125 (last 14 digits of the IBAN).

I have done the config as below: 

conversation function tried both left justified and right justified.

still, it is picking first 14 digits of the IBAN not Last 14 digits.

 

Please help me how to bring last 14 digits (20004374752125) to the Id tag in the DME.

 

Thanks,

Kavitha D

entry.title: Authentification required to access the ATO service
entry.content:
Dear Community,

I am trying to deploy a freestyle SAPUI5 application to our S/4HANA Public Cloud system using Business Application Studio. When I run npm run deploy-config, it prompts me to authenticate in order to access the ATO service (screenshot attached). However, when I enter my S/4HANA Public Cloud development tenant credentials, the authentication fails with the error “Incorrect credentials”—despite entering the correct details.

I am currently using a destination with authentication type set to BasicAuthentication.

I found a similar issue  but seems relevant for On-Premise systems, but I’m not sure which role in S/4HANA Public Cloud provides the ATO-related authorization objects. Additionally, the error message “Incorrect credentials” is misleading, since the credentials are valid for logging into the development tenant.

Has anyone else faced this issue? If so, how did you resolve it?

Thank you!

Best regards,
Karthik

entry.title: Purchase order Percentage Price Condition on Purchase order Item
entry.content:
Hello there lovely SAP Community, 

 

id like to create Purchase orders with Custom Price Condition that is %-Based using the API: 

SAP_COM_0238
 
According to the WSDL the Structure is: 
 
V1:
<PriceCondition>
<!--Optional:-->
<ConditionType>?</ConditionType>
<!--Optional:-->
<ConditionAmount currencyCode="?">?</ConditionAmount>
</PriceCondition>
V2:
<PricingCondition>
<!--Optional:-->
<ConditionType>?</ConditionType>
<!--Optional:-->
<ConditionTypeName>?</ConditionTypeName>
<!--Optional:-->
<ConditionRateValue>?</ConditionRateValue>
<!--Optional:-->
<ConditionCurrency>?</ConditionCurrency>
<!--Optional:-->
<ConditionQuantity unitCode="?">?</ConditionQuantity>
</PricingCondition>
 
The Price Conditons should look like this: 
 

When i Create the PO with this Payload: (Version2) 

<ItemPrice>
<Amount currencyCode="DKK">100</Amount>
<BaseQuantity unitCode="PCE">1</BaseQuantity>
<!--Zero or more repetitions:-->
<PricingCondition>
<ConditionType>ZPB0</ConditionType>
<ConditionRateValue>100</ConditionRateValue>
<!--Optional:-->
<ConditionCurrency>EUR</ConditionCurrency>
<!--Optional:-->
<ConditionQuantity unitCode="PCE">1</ConditionQuantity>
</PricingCondition>
<PricingCondition>
<ConditionType>ZRL1</ConditionType>
<ConditionQuantity unitCode="%">10</ConditionQuantity>
<!--Optional:-->

</PricingCondition>
<PricingCondition>
<ConditionType>ZRZ1</ConditionType>
<ConditionQuantity unitCode="%">10</ConditionQuantity>
<!--Optional:-->
</PricingCondition>
<PricingCondition>
<ConditionType>ZRZ2</ConditionType>
<ConditionQuantity unitCode="%">10</ConditionQuantity>
<!--Optional:-->
<!-- <ConditionQuantity unitCode="P1">100</ConditionQuantity> -->
</PricingCondition>
<PricingCondition>
<ConditionType>ZRZ3</ConditionType>
<ConditionQuantity unitCode="%">10</ConditionQuantity>
<!--Optional:-->
</PricingCondition>
</ItemPrice>

 

The Result looks like this: 

 

 

 

Note that i dont have any %-value. 

How can i set the Price Condition to 10 % ? 

kind regards, 

Philipp

entry.title: 2508 Maintenance Act/Plan app - (WO) descriptions
entry.content: read somewhere in 2508 you can now add descriptions (which for some sort of weird reason are not by default included in apps) yourself. tried it for Maintenance Order Costs - S/4HANA Cloud app but unfortunately not working. am i missing something or others have the same issue? a bit weird from a UX perspective this is not shown by default. no one knows all WO#'s - descriptions is what endusers need for sure. this app is great and has a lot of potential but as many apps not JUST-IT (also not 80/20). keen hear how others cope with this

entry.title: Why asset doest not have material code in SAP ERP?
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

Why does SAP's procurement process require the asset code to be created and linked at the Purchase Requisition (PR) stage, instead of allowing asset creation after the Goods Receipt (GR)? Wouldn't it be more logical to create the asset code only after confirming receipt and valuation of the asset, rather than at the PR entry stage? Instead why don't we create the asset as an material code and link in the PR?

Regards,

Nithin Pranesh

entry.title: Grouping Multiple Dunning Letters into a Single Notice
entry.content:
Dear SAP Experts,

As part of our dunning letter management process, we would like to know if there is a way to group multiple letters into one based on specific criteria (Accountant clerk for instance).

For context, we manage several customer accounts (~1000) that are handled by the same accountant clerk. To improve efficiency for our collections team and maintain a good relationship with clients, we would like to send a single consolidated letter containing the details of all relevant customer accounts.

When reviewing the "Create Dunning Notices" application, it seems that there is currently only one way to enter the list of Business Partners (BPs). With this setup, we believe that the system generates as many separate dunning letters as there are BPs entered, which is not our intended outcome.

Could you please advise ? 

Thank you for your help.
Best regards.

entry.content:

We have already assigned all the required business catalogs and roles to the user as referenced from the SAP Fiori App Library.

However, the app is still not displayed in the user’s launchpad, and when searching in the Fiori Launchpad, it cannot be found.

Why the Manage Service Order app is not visible even after assigning the necessary roles and catalogs?

entry.title: Question on Scope Item 4GQ – Event-Based Revenue Recognition
entry.content:
have a question regarding Event-Based Revenue Recognition for Scope Item 4GQ.

 

We created a single revenue project, set the recognition key to EPMFC, and created sales orders and purchase orders linked to the WBS element. We then executed revenue recognition from the “Run Revenue Recognition – Projects” app, but we received the message below. It says that a re-evaluation is required; however, the 4GQ test script does not describe how to perform this, so could you please advise the next steps?

 

We also checked the “Event-Based Revenue Recognition – Projects” app and concluded that revenue recognition had not been posted for the project. We are attaching screenshots together with the message.

 

Message content:
Re-evaluation requested for WBS element P19-12110 and ledger 0L / accounting principle JPAP
Message no. FINS_REV_REC037

 

Diagnosis
A re-evaluation request recalculates the recognition values for the selected object. Re-evaluation requests are created for example:
- In case of errors during the closing run
- If real-time processing of a source document would require a long runtime
- If real-time processing of an event without a source document would require a long runtim

entry.title: The description of the cost center are not displayed.
entry.content:
Dear All,

In the cost center standard hierarchy of the global hierarchy, the description of the cost center with an effective start date of 2025.10.01 was not displayed.

I found the cause. It seems that the cost center's effective date is applied based on the system date.
However, I think the local time specified by the user in the settings should be specified, not the system date.
Users work based on the local time specified in the settings. 
If you tell users that their cost center description are not displayed because the system date is not the effective date, rather than the SAP server's system date, they will ask why their local time is not being applied.

It seems like there needs to be a feature that allows users to specify a start date for cost center  In the cost center standard hierarchy of the global hierarchy, similar to the standard hierarchy screen (T-code: OKENN) in Private Cloud.

entry.title: "Managing Business Role Changes After an Upgrade" app
entry.content:
Regarding "Managing Business Role Changes After an Upgrade," the official documentation provides the following response.

Use Manage Business Role Changes After Upgrade only when a single change affects one role; otherwise, modify in Maintain Business Role by comparing with the template and applying only necessary updates. 

SAP Help Portal-Best Practices for Managing Business Role Changes After an Upgrade


In this response, what exactly is meant by single changes and multiple changes?
Also, in the screen shown in the following image, does the process of replacing multiple catalogs correspond to multiple changes?

entry.title: Multiple stock types (Avail.Grps with different storage locations) in one bin
entry.content:
Dear Support team,


Quick background of business case: At Belysse we would like to store multiple stock types (availability groups linked to different storage locations) in one storage bin. However, we also would like to use standard best practice with ROD and AFS concept. And we think both can not be achived in standard, unless we've missed some new functionality in public cloud. 


One way could have been is to enhacne it, in order to have the stock type changing during the putaway warehouse task confirmation in final bin, there we do not have any standard BADI available in cloud. Therefore could you please suggest a workaround or possibility to have access to BADI.


Thank a lot for your great support.


Regards,


Manish


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Fixed Asset – Post Asset Acquisition API not posting decimal quantity for UOM - FT
entry.content: Standard API - Fixed Asset – Post Asset Acquisition, is unable to post field QuantityInBaseUnit with decimal values, and is throwing error - "Only 0 decimal places are allowed for unit of measure FOT ". Whereas using Posting Fixed Asset app in system we are manually able to post QuantityInBaseUnit with decimal values. What can be the reason for this inconsistency? Please help out on this.

entry.title: Adding custom condition types to calculation schema for purchasing info records in SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
Dear community, 

we would like to add custom condition types to the calculation schema for purchasing info records. In on-prem systems, it is possible to edit the standard calculation schema to add additional condition types. This does not seem to be the case with Public Cloud systems. Hence, I would like to create a copy of the standard calculation schema AXX001. However, we are unsure where in the system we can define that the Z calculation schema should be applied instead of AXX001 while creating purchasing info records. Could anyone advise if there is a customizing point where this assignment can be maintained?

 

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Activate Account Assignment Objects Configuration for Asset Posting in SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hi all, 

I know there is a setting to activate the additional account assignment object for asset accounting in SAP OP system.
But I couldn't find the same configuration in SAP Public Cloud.

I'd like to post depreciation to WBS element.
Does anyone know whether this configuration is available in SAP Public Cloud?  If so, could you please let me know where to find it?
Thank you.

entry.title: Unable to Deploy RAP application into Fiori launchpad in SAP public cloud(3SL)
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I have created a custom RAP application in Eclipse using a development tenant. The application is working fine in the service binding preview and is showing data correctly.

However, I am facing an issue when trying to deploy this RAP application to the Fiori Launchpad. I am unsure about the correct steps to make it available in the launchpad in the SAP Public Cloud (3-System Landscape).

Has anyone faced the same issue and successfully deployed a RAP application to the Fiori Launchpad? Any guidance or step-by-step instructions would be highly appreciated.

Thank you in advance!

Regards,
Sanjay

entry.title: Description" field
entry.content:
Hello,

I’m working on SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud and I would like to make the "Description" field (item description) read-only in the Purchase Order interface.

Is it possible to achieve this using the Custom Fields and Logic app, a BADI, or through Adapt UI?

If anyone has implemented a similar restriction or can suggest the best approach, I’d really appreciate your help.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Add Field in SO Form Template datasource
entry.content:
I would like to add Size/Dimensions field from product master in SO form template.

 I add Size/Dimensions field to SO form template ds via Custom Fields>Datasource Extensions

Then when I download the SO xml file, the field is included but the value is missing. Why?

Is there anything else I need to do?

Best Regards,

Khaing Zin
